name: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl
Reason: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl is a trimesic acid derivative with three phenyl rings connected by two methylene bridges. The melting point of a basic aromatic system such as benzene is 5.5°C. Each phenyl group can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The methylene bridges can also increase the melting point due to the additional rigidity they introduce. We can estimate the contribution of each methylene bridge at around +10 to +20°C.
